intro: Begonia herveyana var. barnesii, commonly known as the Barnes' begonia, is a striking tropical plant native to Ecuador. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves with intricate patterns of silver and pink veins. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of red and orange, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
